timeline.body: I don't think muzzle will like this since the Advice class itself lives in AgentClassLoader, maybe add helper class and `helperClassNames()` since that's a common need
timeline.bodyText: I don't think muzzle will like this since the Advice class itself lives in AgentClassLoader, maybe add helper class and helperClassNames() since that's a common need
timeline.bodyHTML: I don't think muzzle will like this since the Advice class itself lives in AgentClassLoader, maybe add helper class and helperClassNames() since that's a common need
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Muzzle is not configured in this example. Since there are compile-time dependencies and can it can result in runtime errors I would document this in a readme and add links to issues.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText: I don't understand the concern, tbh :) Do you mean static field in Advice?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
Oh good point about no muzzle here.
I think the only reason this example works is because javac is inlining the string constant.
If doesn't inline the string constant, this should fail, because the advice class itself lives in the AgentClassLoader, while the bytecode inside of the advice methods is injected into the instrumented class, which lives in the user class loader, and so the bytecode inside of the advice methods should not be allowed to reference a static field in the advice class, and you should get a runtime error.
I'd suggest inlining the string here, otherwise it may give the impression that this is a valid pattern (e.g. for Loggers, Tracers, other static fields on Advice).
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Don't think this example has it :) We should remove copyright headers from sample code.
replies.author: anuraaga
